definition: to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to injure/injury/wound
brain/mind/head/essence
muscle/tendon/veins visible under the skin/sth resembling tendons or veins (e.g. fiber in a vegetable)

sentences.english: For years visas have been a neuralgic issue in the region.
sentences.chinese: 多年來，簽證問題一直讓該地區大傷腦筋。

sentences.english: Freshman year at college is a very exciting but nerve-wracking experience.
sentences.chinese: 大學第一年令人興奮，同時也令人傷腦筋。

sentences.english: That's the worst part -- making decisions.
How she should handle this matter troubled her greatly .
sentences.chinese: 她該怎樣處理這件事使她大傷腦筋。

sentences.english: They are puzzling through the new rules of the game.
sentences.chinese: 他們正在對新比賽規則大傷腦筋。

sentences.english: He puzzled his brains about the matter.
Fig1. Selection of a proper PR company means a big brain twister…
sentences.chinese: 選擇一家適合自已的公關公司是一件傷腦筋的事情。

sentences.english: One of the annoyances of working here is the difficulty of parking near the office.
sentences.chinese: 裏工作有一件傷腦筋的事，在辦公處附近很難停車。

sentences.english: "I don't have your worries, " quavered the veteran.
sentences.chinese: “我沒有你那麼多傷腦筋的事，”老兵顫抖抖地說。

sentences.english: I found im having a problem wiz myself.
sentences.chinese: 我就多了個相當傷腦筋的問題。

sentences.english: So they put in nerve-racking 16-hour days and work seven-day weeks.
sentences.chinese: 所以他們將在七天，傷腦筋的截斷工作幾個星期。

sentences.english: Now I got problem picking loquats.
English grammar tasked the boy' s mind.
sentences.chinese: 英文語法使那男孩大傷腦筋。

sentences.english: The spelling of English is often puzzling.
sentences.chinese: 英語的拼寫法常常使人傷腦筋。

sentences.english: He sits puzzling over ancient Hebrew texts.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在那裏對着古老的希伯來文本大傷腦筋。

sentences.english: This caused a real dilemma, especially for those in primary care.
sentences.chinese: 這導致了一個大傷腦筋的事，尤其是那些在主要照顧。

definition: to be up to one's ears in work (idiom)/to be unable to attend to other things at the same time
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
hard to understand/incomprehensible
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to speak softly/to whisper (idiom)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to smash
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to use one's brains/to think
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
to force someone to do something
to quit while one is ahead (idiom)/to know when to stop
